review: Great service. Plates came out quick. Everything tasted very fresh. Apparently all restaurant chains are not created equal. Two thumbs way up!

I ordered this place last night to enjoy their chicken tequila fettuccine pasta to go. I usually order from the Tampa location located in the northridge mall but for some reason the price for the pasta was listed at 37$ through postmates so I decided to order at another location where the price was around 16$ for the same plate.  When it got to my house I was so excited because USUALLY that pasta is to die for! So good! I was extremely upset at what I got in my box. First, I asked for sundried tomatoes (normally not a problem to add at the Tampa location) to be added to my pasta. For some reason  they cut up a whole tomato and just threw it in so that added a weird taste overall. To add to that, the pasta tasted nothing like it should have. It was too oily, the sauce was completely off and the chicken tasted bland and undercooked like there was no seasoning added. I know the (not sundried) tomatoes may have changed the taste overall but my boyfriend had ordered the same plate with extra chicken no tomatoes and it STILL tasted like something a first grader threw together. So disappointed. And if this is how the food normally is, I won't be ordering from this location again.

Decor - Very yellow. Entrees/ food - I always get the waldorf salad and bbq chicken pizza. The salad is always perfect, but sometimes the BBQ chicken pizza doesn't have enough sauce on it. Dessert - Salted caramel pudding is too sweet. Drinks - cucumber reviver is refreshing. Kids love -  any of the pastas. Price - ok. ** I always feel rushed (by the servers). Countless times I've eaten here, I've wanted to order another cocktail, but they give me my bill instead, before asking if I needed anything else. I think I'm a pretty nice customer - Am I that dispensable ??!!! But I've been coming to CPK for years because their Waldorf salad is still one of the best versions around, so I'll still be nice and give them a 3/5. **

I love the CPK franchise. I am a huge fan of their menu and everything CPK.  These two stars are purely for service and hospitality. My two friends and i came into this location at 8 o clock maybe just a few mins after 8, but nonetheless more than an hour if not an hour and half before closing. It's not busy, just a couple of tables The hostess, I didn't catch her name, didn't seem very happy to seat us. Being a young group, all of us about 20, i figured a little attitude was just because we were "kids." Then again though, we are 20. We sat down for a gooooood 10+ mins before our server, Andrew, came to say hello. Again, it's really not that busy. He takes our order it's all good. After a while, we didnt get the complimentary bread, so we asked for some. He brought the bread, but we didn't get plates. We waited for him to come back either with plates out just to even come outside to check on his other tables which didn't happen. We waited to the point where i got up and went to get the plates myself. Once we finished the bread, i stacked up the plates and put them right on the corner for him so it's easier for him to pick it up later on to clear the table. the food comes out pretty fast and he put it down on the table but doesn't pick up the dirty plates stacked neatly for him. throughout the entire dinner the plates were still on the table. when we were finally all done with our dinner I stacked up every single plate for him on the table so it was easier for him to clear it. finally comes out to check up on us we order dessert and ask for the check. the desert took a little while to come out. a chocolate souffle that turned out to just be a chocolate brownie? (we also got charged for additional ice cream we didnt order but that's okay). the check did not come. I had to get up again to go get the check. we left at 9:30. it took an hour and a half for two entrees one appetizer and one dessert. it wasn't the food that took long to come out but it was more the server. we waited a while for just small things.  waiting for him to come back and get our credit cards and for him to bring the check back so we can sign it also took a while. gave him our validation tickets for parking and he didn't bring that back we had to go in and get it ourselves.

It's not a Gordon Ramsay establishment, but the food is always consistent.  They hire a lot of entertainment hopefuls as servers and they give it a good try.  The servers are not career restaurant people at this location.  But they are at least friendly and well meaning.  It's a very kid friendly spot.  VERY!  Kids have to eat somewhere.  I think it's expensive for what you get.  I ordered a house wine, got a nice headache from it.  It was cheap.  But not on the bill.  I resent that a tad.  All in all the place has a nice atmosphere.  You won't starve.
Really not sure why I came here. It us3d to be the bomb but now it is extremely mediocre. Service was non existent. Food made me a little ill. No need t9 cone back...ever.
This is easily by far my favorite CPK. The GM, Susan is always very accommodating and keeps the staff professional and they always have a nice attitude!

Been here so many times every single time it's a good experience. Been here with family for work lunches. The food is consistently good and the service is great. Treat the workers with a smile and respect and they do the same back or vice versa.

Management and the hostess sucks here at organization. Tables were empty yet we waited 15 mins to get a seat. Moving on...to the food The pizza was sub par, below average... I used to love and praise the pizza but I don't know if the pizza specifically here sucks or just at all the CPK's now. The dough was soft and soggy, didn't taste freshly hand made as it usually does.  The pasta was also extremely thin on sauce, so most of it was plain pasta and we paid an extra $3 for chicken upgrade and it only came with 2 pieces of chicken :/ Ok well what can I say that's good now to end this review? At least their waitress was nice and their mango cooler drink was consistent :P

location: Northeast Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: It's a really nice location and very nice and friendly ambience. Great customer service. I love their Thai BBQ Pizza!

This is def my favorite cpk to go to ive been going here for years and know all the employees , always amazing service the food comes out quick and everything is perfect love to come here for a quick lunch!

The customer service is very low. The dining area was not clean. We did not receive our utensils. The waitress was so impolite. The food was really good. We ordered mojito which was not as good as it supposed to be. Overall is 2 stars.
The food was not as bad as people lead to believe, I rather enjoyed it. Service was greet and the waitress extremely helpful. The manager walked the floor and made sure everyone was content.
Fast service!!! For a lunch time :) food is good, just not enough napkins:) I had to ask them 2 times for it

Worse place ever the floors are dirty tables to waiters rude and slow. Waiter took the order and left the he brought dirty plates. The he brought the foods but still we didn't have silverware and no drinks. Then he brought cold coffee from yesterday and on on don't even think to go there.
Pizza was pretty average. Couldn't remember the name but here is the picture. Verdict: Might come back to try other pizzas but not anytime soon

PRISCILLA!  So Priscilla was our server today. We had a beautiful view outside with such a wonderful young lady serving us. She was amazing. She was fast with every single thing she did for my family and I. I couldn't complain about one thing that she did.... she made us all laugh and my mom couldn't get enough of her she was amazingly great, respectful, funny, energetic, and gorgeous. She even allowed my baby niece to order for herself and the best part was that she made sure it was okay with us. She ran all our food and gave us so much bread because we LOVE BREAD. We felt so bad we made her run and get us bread like 6 times but she always had a beautiful smile on her face and cracked multiple jokes as she did to her other table that were next us.  Encino CPK is the place to be... But only if PRISCILLA is serving you! You could never go wrong with having Priscilla as your server.  Cpk staff is lucky to have a great young woman like her.  P.S. she told me that my salad would taste better with chicken and I tried it and it was delicious!

The pastor was very delicious, I came here with my sister and we grabbed it so much. The customer service was pretty great I got water refills whenever I needed and they always type up on us thank you

CPK is one of my client's fave go-to places for pizza. This branch in particular is close to his Hebrew school so it's very convenient for us to drive by and have lunch here. I do commend their excellent service especially the hostess (I believe her name is Kristy) and our server Flori. Thanks for keeping a fun and family friendly environment! They even picked up the tab of the servicemen and women sitting next to our table! Will definitely be taking my client back here! That's for sure!

It was my first time dining at this location and I can say it has been the best compared to other CPKs. The food was amazing as always. The service was much better than what I'm used too. Saul A. made sure we always had refills. Not once did I have to flag him down. He was on point with his service. Thank you so much for providing such great service.

Wonderful server named Priscilla took care of me and provided some of the best service I've had from any restaurant. She was extremely friendly and outgoing. Made perfect recommendations and suggestions to the entire group I was with, making it a very pleasant experience. Anyone lucky enough to get her as a server will not be disappointed.
We had an especially great dinner tonight.  Food was superb (ribeye was amazing...yes, CPK has incredible steak), but the best part was out waitress, Flori.  Such a sweetheart. Perfect evening!

Another great spot to eat. Have been eating here for years and years. The food is always very good, very consistent in this particular location.  The staff are grest especially Mario who has been taking such good care of us all these years.  Definitely one of my favorite places, we eat here once a week minimum.

Hello ? Customer service? where are you?  Lazy kitchen staff , sorry but it is very true. My ribeye was chewy , my brownie was served cold , with cold ice cream , mmmm brownie that taste like refrigerant. I knew they would think i was trying to get a freebie so i waited until AFTER i paid to let them know that it was served cold , regardless though my daughter ate it cause 5 year olds just see chocolate chocolate chocolate. but what really motivated my review was the waiters response. What do you want me to do about it? I dont know how about apologize , offer me a new one, offer me one to go , you know ... have some sense of customer service man. If i have to tell you what to do i think that's a problem So i think the yelp 2 stars is fitting for this , meh , ive experienced better service , better cooking better hospitality at other pizza kitchens. Wont be coming back here.

Good food really enjoyed my meal. The service was good as well.  We had the avacado egg rolls they were really tasty. Bacon, cheese, tomato, chicken, and avacado.  Great bite  Had the bbq chicken salad as well the chicken was fresh and the bbq sauce was really good.  For dinner we had the BBQ chicken pizza. Awesome sauce. Baked to perfection. The chews was good with onion and cilantro no overwhelming at all.  The only down fall that I saw was when I asked for the check with out looking at the bill I just handed him my credit card. When the bill came back to sign the waiter underlined the 20% tip that I should pay or that he thought he deserved. Thought that was a little out of bounds there.  Like I didn't know how to tip or he thought I should give him 20%. I gave him more but thought It was a little disrespectful at the same time.
The staff was great but it took them 3 tries to make the right pizza. lol ready it's a pizza place how can It go wrong but it did. We also had the chicken pesto pasta it was amazing.

I hadnt been to CPK in many years and had always thought of CPK as being kind of mediocre. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was here. I went here for a birthday of a family member and we had a large table of 9. The service throughout the meal was good and the staff was attentive. I ordered the cedar planked salmon which came with a corn succotash. i asked if i could substitute roasted potatoes for the succotash because it had bell peppers in it which i cannot eat, this wasnt an issue however they charged me an extra $2 to do so which i found very weird. When i asked why the guy said something about it being more expensive, ad I'm thinking potatoes are one of the cheapest ingredients there are...anyway, the roasted potatoes were delicious and worth the $2 charge. The salmon was a little bit on the dryer side but overall i really enjoyed it. The complimentary bread and dipping oil was nice to have as well. They had a seasonal salad that i cant remember the name of but it was outstanding, it had farro, a grain i hadnt had before which i really enjoyed. parking is free when they validate your ticket. it was pretty noisy when were first arrived at 715 but after 8 it quieted down a lot. overall it was good food and good service. i did feel though, the prices were a bit high, specifically for the steaks, fish dishes, etc.  for what you get.
Kendall gave us great service. Nice ambiance and the food was really good. Try the starters too, they are tremendous.

You can never go wrong with CPK. They always offer new dishes and they have a seasonal menu all of their pizzas are delicious and their flatbreads are great too. I like that they have a menu that has smaller dishes on it something you can have as a side or as a snack if you're not too hungry.  Since I am a huge salad fan I appreciate the variety of salads that they offer- The Mediterranean is one of my favorites!

I was there today with two of my friends. Service was terribly slow.l!!! It took 35 mins for our appy to come out and then another 30 for our lunch. The restaurant was not very crowded. I had to keep asking for water before they finally brought it. The server kept apologizing and knew service was bad. I understand that sometimes these things can happen however, I did not appreciate the fact that the manager was selective about which tables she would personally visited to apologize for any issues. She never once came over to our table. I've been to multiple CPK's. This was the worst one. I will go back to the other CPK's not his one. Thanks but not a great visit today!

I'm really having mixed feelings on how many stars to give. I wrote a review on another location. I had received vouchers for free stuff. I decided to use a coupon here to give it a shot. I never ate here after my bad experience and unfortunately I still feel that way after this visit. We ordered the white pizza which was both salty and had no flavor so we got the Sicilian pizza which was much better. But I only had 1 slice. The dessert was really good. Got the Caramel pudding. So yummy! Got the cheese ravioli and it was pretty good. Bread was good too. Ok now the service. Ummm worst service than the location I left a review on. It we not very busy and at one point we were literally the only people there. Our waiter was nice but a little rude towards the end while trying to get our receipt fixed. Super slow! The manager and employees were chatting up a storm forever sitting near the register. They were so loud! At one point they all sat down to eat. Like really! Umm you have customers! How rude! So annoying.  The nicest person there was the hostess. I really don't want to come back again. I gave then another shot and my friend and I were very disappointed!

the management here leaves a lot to be desired.  I was in last night for dinner and was disappointed in the lack of customer service the manager provided.  I was sitting on the patio and had to go in into the dining room because our pizzas were cold.  When the I asked the girl at the bar for the manager she called her over and the manger told her to tell me to hold on.  This was around 9pm so it wasnt very busy anymore she was just hanging out by the kitchen.  Once she came up to me she did end up taking care of my pizzas but it was the way that she carried herself that was  disappointing. her attitude was that of one that was being bothered by someone that was asking for free things when all I wanted was my food to be hot which is not too much to ask when you are a paying customer.  To top it off as I was walking back to my table I glanced over and I could see her talking and rolling her eyes which I'm going to assume this was all geared towards me since I had just spoken to her.  This person should go back to training because if this is how she carries herself she is not only rude but is VERY unprofessional.

Came here spontaneously for dinner and I really enjoyed this place. Our food came so quick and our server, Andrew, seemed delighted to be serving us. We were in the middle of eating our appetizer when our main course arrived so I was surprised to see how fast this place serves. Although this place is a bit far from where I live, I'd definitely stop by again if I'm in the area.
This CPK is soo nice -- out door seating :) :). Order online for pick up -- online order pick up by the bar inside!

I've recently become a fan of CPK. In the past, I probably wasn't ordering the correct items, and also, they now have bread that they give that is sooo delicious with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  Their thin crust pizzas are shockingly good. It's crispy, thin, and also flavorful. I do wish that they had other flavors available, but that's okay.

What a wonderful experience. The staff turned what we thought would be an ordinary night out into something special. First the manager noticed my utlra pregnant belly and after some small talk let us know dessert would be on her... our waiter James was the coolest guy ever. Service was on point!  The food was yummy and came out timely. Ordered fried mac and cheese small plate (which was comp'd after registering in their rewards program), bbq chicken salad and cobb salad.  Everything was delicious.  Look forward to a  future "out of the ordinary" night out at CPK soon.  Thanks for making this mommy to be feel special.

Worst place. Service was a disaster and rude. Our pizza was cold! And old. When we asked to change it they were extremely rude about it. The new whole pizza was cut into 4 slices, when we told them to please cut it they literally cut the pizza in to one one inch slices. Horrible place, don't go to this CPK, go somewhere els

Sometimes a chain restaurant just does it better - when it comes to families that is. I am a big fan of CPK, I can't lie, but in my latest culinary adventures I had been trying to steer clear of the chain. Circumstances brought us here on a sunny Saturday and it was just what we needed. Great, reliable food (especially with their updated menu), plenty of hospitality for the kiddos and lots of fun for the whole family on the downstairs merry-go-round. Nothing surprising here but just a good sigh of relief that we can depend on CPK for a good lunch! -  See more at the site in my profile!

CPK has been consistently good! My family and I go often! We usually start with the chicken dumplings with extra ginger sauce and the pea barley sauce!! Both are delicious!!! The kids both can eat an individual pizza and I order the BBQ chicken pizza- a classic. My only disappointment is the price- it's expensive for pizza- but every place has gotten expensive.

Came here last night (Friday) for dinner. The wait time for 2 wasn't bad considering it's a Friday night during their dinner rush. Our server was Jen and she was really friendly and attentive. Also her drink choices were great and the food was good.  I had the club pizza (tasty) and the Harvest Soup which was also very creamy and delicious. Only reason for the minus star was due to being seated in the middle of the room surrounded by crying toddlers and children but it WAS a Friday night so I'm sure it's not like that during the week.

We came here after our session at Mother's Haven (next door, for which review will be posted momentarily) as we were starving and around 4pm. they were pretty much empty.  Of course as soon as we came a few other folks did as well, but that's usually the case when I arrive some where.  LEGACY! I had the spaghetti with kang pao chicken and peanuts.  Good dish!  I had it before and decided to take it now too.  The bread is also very good here with the olive oil and all.  Excellent service, better treatment than most places of such stature.  After, we went to The Fox house, to visit and eat some Thai Food.  Fox is finally, meaning came around and is a Republican....scored close to Trump.  This is a good sign as if he can change, anybody can change.

Truly the worst service ever. Server wrote the order word for word and still didn't get it right. I don't think I've never had a great experience here. Management really needs to work on service here. What makes this place ok is that the quality of the food is good. Please do something. About the service here.

The hostess, who if I could remeber correctly is named Alyssa, was so kind to my family and I when we came in for dinner. She helped us with everything we needed and I could tell she was very hard at work. She made our experience great and the overall service was amazing too. Definitey coming back!
It's a really nice location and very nice and friendly ambience. Great customer service. I love their Thai BBQ Pizza!

Honestly one of my favorite CPKs, they have great customer service.  Servers are very attentive.  If there is ever anything wrong, they deal with it head on. I'm a fan of the CPK menu and I love their customer service.

Andrew, next time you pack up your customers' food pay attention to who you hand them to. Now my friend has my delicious jambalaya leftovers for lunch and i have her soggy chinese salad. Bummer!!! I'd say you guys owe me for the $18 plate that i didn't get to eat!
Slices are too thin. Too little toppings. For example, you order BBQ Chicken, and you find only a few tasteless pieces of chicken.

I love this location, and I've loved CPK for a while now and Dominic is the best California Pizza Kitchen server I've had to date. He's a funny guy, and we will be back specifically to be served by him. The manager doesn't seem like she's very fun, but at least we have Dominic. Definitely will be back.
CPK rocks! Dominic hooked it up with that extra ranch and fabulous service. Will come back asap!
nice place, good for family and very good California Club pizza. Me and my family enjoy the food and atmosphere.

I love CPK. Their food is always stellar and a treat to enjoy. Sadly, this location must have been  having a bad day. I ordered the California Fields salad, which has become a favourite with me. It was brought out in decent time, but there was a big piece of white lint sticking right out of the chicken at the top. How that got past the kitchen, I'll never know. I also don't know how the waiter didn't see it. So I called the manager and she sent it back. The next salad came back clean, or so I thought until I began mixing the chicken into the rest of the salad. Another piece of lint stuck to the greens poked out. Appetite lost, I called the waiter over. By that point, I just told them to take it off the bill and then bring the amended bill over, which they did. They did offer a replacement of some sort, but by then my appetite was gone and I didn't trust anything else from that kitchen.  Not going back. I wouldn't be surprised about something like this happening at some dive or fast food place. But not when I'm paying over $10 for a half salad.

Best customer service I've ever experienced at a restaurant. Super friendly hostess, great wait staff, amazing head of staff. Just all around fantastic and will only go to this cpk from now on. Now that's customer service.
we ordered delivery. The pizza came overcooked. Definitely not gonna do it ever again!

Great food, chill atmosphere.  We came to celebrate my best friend's birthday, and I'm so glad we did! Our server, the lovely and tentative Andrew, always made sure we were happy and hydrated. I really appreciate service like this. Thank you for the awesome experience, we will surely return!!
The place is awesome and so it the food. Check it out. They have a wide selection of menu,

I love CPK, and this location was no exception. Just a warning though, the parking structure entrance is off of Woodley and it's valet only.  Granted you get 2 hrs of free valet parking with a validation from cpk, so don't forget that.   Anyways, the service was very friendly.  The seating hostess already had 2 menus in hand when she saw us walking and was ready to bring us straight in.  She mentioned the cpk club and how to register. Our server Nick quickly came and went over the seasonal menu and took our drink order.  Got a nice cold Sam Adams seasonal beer to go with the California cobb pizza. It was really good. Nick also offered us a free small plate to hold us over until our food came. We got the guacamole and chips which was good. Overall, the food and service was good. The parking might have been a hassle because it was unexpected but I would come her again if I had a CPK craving

The Service: Our server, Amber, is AWESOME!!! Super attentive and sweet~ Service is very efficient. All the staffs are very friendly and professional~ The Food: Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla - A CPK favorite. Lime chicken, Monterey Jack, caramelized onions, roasted peppers, black beans and cilantro, baked in our hearth oven. Served with housemade ranchito sauce. (love the housemade ranchito sauce.... so creamy!) Asparagus and Arugula Salad - A CPK favorite. Tossed in housemade lemon vinaigrette with sun-dried tomatoes, toasted almonds and shaved Parmesan. (very light salad and refreshing, less than $5!) White Corn Guacamole and Chips - Diced avocado, sweet white corn, black beans, jicama, bell pepper, cilantro and serrano peppers. (all fresh ingredient, less than $4!) Two in a Bowl soup - Sedona Tortilla (Vine-ripened tomatoes, tomatillos and corn with mild green chilies and Southwestern spices. Garnished with tortilla strips) and Dakota Smashed Pea and Barley (A hearty split pea soup with barley, carrots, onions and savory herbs. Garnished with scallions). (perfect light lunch option, and go so well with their freshly baked bread) The Parking: Valet parking ($2 for 2 hours with validation) and Street Metered Parking

Comfortable, tasty, reliable yet not cookie-cutter. We had a server who must have been really new or he got slammed and we couldn't tell. Other then a couple balls dropped, service was fine.  I usually avoid chains, even nice friendly positive vibed chains like CPK. This one felt especially new and cool. I tried one of their 'favorites,' the fish tacos. They had a great presentation. good salsa and a side of avocado. The fish itself wasn't too greasy or fried-feeling. I thought it was a well put-together meal, if not amazingly flavorful. Then again, I put their dressing on the side _ like I do everywhere else. The turkey sandwich uses real turkey -- not sliced deli meat.  Street parking.  In a strip mall.

I've been coming to California Pizza Kitchen for many years. Me and my family decided to go to the Encino location (which we've been to before). Our experience was nice for the most part. The food was good, the waiter we had was friendly and the service wasn't slow.  However, I'd like to address two things. The waiter asked me if I wanted salt on the rim of the glass of my drink, I said yes. My drink came with no salt on the rim. To me, that isn't such a big deal so I didn't say anything.  The second thing I would like to address is the manager that was walking around asking people how everything was. What offended me was how she asked every other table excluding ours. I am not sure what that was about but regardless, I just think that people should be treated equally, especially when we are paying for your service. Not sure what that was about.
Cassidy at the bar is the best. Such a nice person. Bill can rack up fast so just pay attention if you're on a budget. Great salads if you're watching what you eat. Good soups too.

I went here with a decent sized group and the service was still great. I don't remember parking being too difficult (I'm pretty sure it was valet), either which is always nice.  The pizza here is really good. It's not the cheapest, but it's good.  We got our food pretty quickly and they were able to split the check up into 7 or 8 orders after we got the bill.  I liked this CPK location and would go back again.
Love this CPK! The food is delicious and the service is the best. Everyone is so nice and attentive!!

Horrible experience, we ordered food it came out 30 minutes later. We ask for an umbrella for the Sun, is it not provide that we were sitting under the Sun and we could not enjoy your food. Half of our table couldn't finish their food we couldn't enjoy the dining experience. We called the manager so many times regarding the umbrella what we got no response. Plus plates and utensils were all dirty we ask for new ones and it came out dirty too. I do not recommend this place

I'm a big fan of CPK. Pizza is one of my favorites and they do a great job here. I like this restaurant because you can go for lunch or dinner and it's great all the time. My favorite pizzas are the wild mushroom and California veggie. The atmosphere is great with windows around the entire dining area. There is also an outdoor patio but I have never sat there because it has either been too hot or too cold. The service is good for the most part, although there is the occasional new waitress in training. Valet parking is easy in the underground lot.
Wahoo, they have gluten free dishes!
I lourve the shrimp & chicken lettuce wraps. They are perfect for two and if u want to eat light. If you mention you are the "designated driver" you get a free non-alcholic drink!
Amazing food! I always get the Thi chicken spring rolls and the barbecue chicken chop salad, to die for!!!!'
You can't go wrong with cpk great place great service and the most important great food!  comes here with my family almost every weekend and we always enjoy our time here :)

Thought I'd give them another try with curbside. Yet again, I am waiting with crying kids in the car while they take an additional 20 minutes over the specific promised time to bring down my order. Really disappointed with this location. Who knows when the food will get here.... ????? Maybe another 10 min?!?! Unacceptable.

This CPK needs a little help.... By that I mean they seem a little "frazzled" by the lunch time rush.  We got seated pretty quickly and the hostess validated our parking fast, but it took probably 10 minutes before our drink and food order were taken.  Also, it took our food forever to come out.  Our waiter did at least bring us some bread to eat in the mean time and kept our drinks refilled, but it didn't seem like the kitchen had it together to keep the food coming out at a steady pace. Once we got our food the quality was perfect.  Every time I come here it seems like there is new staff or new management.  Hopefully they will get it together soon.

I used to love coming here to get a giant chef salad or pizza.  Most recently though, I ordered a simple cheese pizza and it was overcooked and texture was like the sole of a shoe. I don't think it was old ingredients but really the cheese must have hardened whist the pizza remained in the oven too long. That and my date had a meat sauce with poor quality meat (lots of inedible gristle). I am usually one to finish my pizza so the fact that neither of us finished  says a lot.  Service was fine. They were apologetic and offered to replace the pizza but I had lost my appetite.   I don't think I will be back to this CPK.

With a manager like Mike, how can you go wrong?  Met the manager on one of our visits here and he was outstanding.  He made sure our order was brought out with no problems and was eager to assist his crew in making sure the customers were taken care of. My favorite item is the BBQ chicken salad and after I make the rounds on the menu with several different trips, I always recharge my batteries with a good ole BBQ chicken salad.  Love it.  I always order extra dressing and that way I can control how much I have during the meal.  The got this down right! For those warm SF Valley days, they have a great patio and with the restaurant being on the second floor, it makes for a good outdoor meal.  They also have a large waiting area because anyone who eats at a CPK knows you're gonna have to wait a bit to get a table on the weekends.  Great set up and great service from the staff.  I like the fact that the staff is comfortable with the customers and make conversation-no robots. You really can't go wrong at CPK because they really make sure that the customer comes first.  I'll always come back here because Mike does a great job! Thanks Mike!
Had a friendly, funny waiter but wasn't very attentive when it came to my drink, other than that this place was great. Food took a while, but it was delicious either way.

We love all the CPK restaurants and the Encino location is no exception. Had dinner here to support the kids' Kirk O' The Valley School. 20% of our bill went to support the school which is awesome. Apparently everyone else felt the same way because the restaurant was packed with a 30 minute wait. Hosts and managers were so nice and tried to accomodate us in the wait. Great staff and service.

There were more than 10 employee's when we arrived... there were about the same number of guests ( i think three tables were occupied when we sat down)...the lady, that seated us, was downright gruff.  We brought our three kids (it was fathers day) she gave us two kids menus.  The service was very slow... the food took over 20 minutes... did I forget to mention that it took over 10 minutes to get our beverages and a small helping (we had 4 adultss and 3 kids - they gave us 8 tiny pieces of stale bread? Believe me I could be tougher on this review!!! No way I'll go back here..  I gave it 3stars because the food was not bad.

I love this location!!!! Waiters are always nice and respectful and for some reason really funny. They always suggest great items from the menu and one of the waiters got my bf into bluemoon!! Patio is the best. Must gooo! !

Decided to go to CPK for dinner. The food is always good there. But I had never tried their dessert. The waiter suggested the red velvet cake. It was really good! Everyone there was very helpful and polite!

When it comes to pizza, I prefer mine cooked in a wood-fired oven, or Chicago-style.  This place has a variety of gourmet pizzas cooked in a wood-fired oven. They originated the barbecue chicken pizza, and it is one of the better items on their menu. I don't each much dairy anymore, but pizza is one of the few places I make an exception.  I don't eat pizza often, but when I do, California Pizza Kitchen and BJ's Brew House are my two favorite places.  I come to CPK when I want a gourmet experience, and I go to BJ's when I want a Chicago-style. The rest of the menu is pretty damned good here, as well, so it works if friends want pizza, and I'm just getting an entree or salad of some kind.

Service Sucked! Place was half empty saturday afternoon and still had to wait for our waitress to take our order over 15 minutes. Asked for bread four times and still nothing until I went to the manager to complain. Pizza came cold cause our waitress left it sitting on the bar. Finally I walked over to ask for it and the bus boy brought it to our table. the waitress came by our table twice whole time we were there. My five year even asked her if she was new and the waitress replied no why? Cause you are not doing a good job the five year old answered!

The place is pretty big. I'm not crazy about the location. It's on the second floor of a building and the parking is under ground and I had to pay a few dollars for it. I am not a fan of valet parking. The food itself was okay.

This has got to be the grossest CPK ever. We used to eat at cpk often, but now that this is our local one, we only go when we're having an extreme craving. Seriously, this location just kinda sucks. The food tastes sad. Yeah, you read that right- sad. That said, we still go every now and then. A girl's gotta nom on bbq chicken salads, come on!
Great service and great food. But I was disappointed to find out that they took 4 cheese ravioli out of the menu.

I've dined at this and other CPK locations before. If you are a fan, I would suggest another location. Our party of four arrived mid-week before any dinner rush. The restaurant was not even half full. However, service was extremely slow. Not sure if they were short-staffed in terms of servers or kitchen staff. There seemed to be many people walking around with headsets - but perhaps they weren't communicating?  We had to change our table as the late afternoon sun was reflecting off a building nearby. It looked like blinds had been removed for some reason (the brackets were still visible). Our drink order came in a fair amount of time. I had iced coffee with cream and sugar - but it came without a spoon to stir. Our server quickly came back with a spoon. We waited longer than we would have liked for our meal. There were no complimentary breads or chips to start. I think this is true of all CPK locations? I noticed other tables waiting for food as well.  When the meals arrived, one of the pasta dishes was not hot. Our server took it back and returned with a new dish (not just re-heated). That was a pleasant surprise.  My fish tacos were a bit skimpy, though the mahi mahi was fine. There could have been some additional sauce on the coleslaw. There really weren't too many people in the restaurant so it seemed like service should have been better. Maybe the kitchen was busy cooking for pick up customers?  Our server, while nice enough, seemed harried. Also, the noise level was quite high and we had to raise our voices a bit to have any conversation. Not the best dining experience.

Ordered take out. The GM, Susan, ended up assisting me when I arrived. The order was fine but as we were getting the bill tallied up, someone had placed the pasta dishes in the warmer oven. So to no one's fault, I had left without three pasta dishes. It wasn't until I had got back to the office (about a half mile away) with everyone's food that we realized what was missing. As we were unpacking everything (literally as we figured out what was missing), Susan arrived with our missing pasta dishes! She was AWESOME!  That was some of the best customer service I've seen! Happy Holidays!  And thanks again Susan!

I hesitate to write this review because I hate to set a precedent for this place, but I feel a selfish need to express gratitude. Our office orders from this CPK quite a bit. Today I went to pick up an order for four people. It was extremely busy, they were understaffed with servers, and a pile-up had formed at the take-out counter. From order to pick-up, it took over an hour for them to have our food ready. I'm sure no one in line was happy, but no one was being vocal or threatening either.  Nonetheless, when we finally got our order, they just gave it to us for free. That was surprising. I'm used to lame consolation prizes from other restaurants like a free appetizer they were going to throw away anyway as goodwill bribes for poor service. A free meal? That usually takes some grumblin', and there was no grumblin' here. I'd be even more ecstatic if I were saving myself money instead of my office. This place always gets busy around lunch time, though not usually this busy. Slip-ups happen. I get it. A free lunch redeems a lot though. Thanks.

True! I've experienced better.  I got here been hungry and very thirsty. One waiter showed up, introduced himself, meaning he will be my waiter. And... nothing, zero! He didn't bring even a glass of a water after.  I believe, I'd been waiting for more than 15 minutes and started looking around. One waitress  asked me if I need something. Sure, California Club w/chicken sandwich from Tacos+Sandwiches section, coffee and glass of water.  I'm thankful to her for paying attention and a good service. Most-likely,such a 'delay' happened because they were changing stations or smth. But, I assume I had to be notified about that, so I would be waiting for more than 15 minutes and looking around and asking if I can order.  In general, the food is good.

Because this is a chain restaurant, I don't have a whole lot to say about their food, except that it's pretty consistent and not that bad. They have definitely revamped their menu, probably with the hopes of projecting a bit more upscale vibe. I love the spinach and artichoke dip, but I always request pita bread instead of the chips. Delicious. Service was pretty good. My biggest complaint about this location is the parking situation. Street parking is almost impossible, and even with validation, you're still gonna end up paying.

Just ate lunch with some out of town friends. I had eaten at other CPK's in the past with great success, not this time... "Mario" was our server, here are a few of the highlights- Appetizer came after the main course was served, had to ask someone else for drink refills, completely forgot my friends drink order, rolled his eyes when told another guest needed her check (seen from a short distance).. All in all, the service was just horrible.  I gave the waitress/hostess, that I had to flag down for drink refills, a separate tip. I gave it 2 stars for the food and the hostess/waitress. Will not be going to this location again.
This location have really step it up! Manager and servers are friendlier and their service has upgraded to great!

Good location, good service, easy parking. Salad I had wasn't very good, bread wasn't very good, and there were no vegan pizza options (not necessary but still).  Looked like they were incorporating some healthier veg options, like a quinoa salad, which is good. Overall, not impressed!
give your employees parking. we are sick of having no parking on  huston street because of you. join us in a neighborhood boycott. its been months and there is no solution.

I had the most unpleasant experience last weekend at this location. Came in Sunday evening around 6 with my little boy and girl and choose to sit outside in the patio since it seemed full inside. Our server took over 10 minutes to get to us, luckily the bus boy brought us out some warm bread and was nice enough to bring us our drinks. Shortly after the we order our food and and it was getting dark and cold, the bus boy started moving heaters around and was nice enough to put one next to our table so my little ones wouldn't get sick from the cold. As it got filled with people outside people started asking for heaters. One manager came outside and started pacing around she seemed asian.. she called the bus boy to take the heater that was next to my kids and place it next to another table that had just gotten there. I was left in disbelief with a very sour taste in my mouth. I wont be returning to this location. My kids got sick cause of that.

BY FAR THE WORST CPK I EVER BEEN TOO!!!! Worst service even the waiters there are extremely rude!! If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I would not recommend coming here!! Better to drive the extra couple miles and enjoy what you are paying for. I have never been to a place and left this unhappy. Never coming here again worst customer service ever!!!!!!!!!!!

Horrible customer service. I left for dinner and lost my card at the restaurant. I called panicking about my card and they put me on hold for 15-20 minutes. She answered the phone and said "I'm sorry we are busy can I take your name and number" I doubt it got busy in 30 seconds! No common sense to tell me that from the beginning! She didn't care that I was panicking and worried. Apparently it's all $$$ and no service. I will never give my business again to staff that doesn't care about customers. She heard the panic in my voice but cared less!

I hope it's just this location but last time I went...they said they don't serve the Szechuan Slaw anymore. I LOVED that stuff! Also, we kind of had to beg for a waiter here..probably waited about 20 minutes at the table before seeing anyone....I'll go to the other location next time.

First time here today, Usually go to the Simi location or Northridge. We sat outside which is nice. Our waiter Carlos was decent, but didn't bring us any bread, didn't even ask if we wanted it. We noticed another waiter brought the bread out with the drinks. I had to ask the hostess to bring us some. I had the Chinese chicken salad and mango tea. My salad was not very fresh, lettuce was super soggy not crispy. My friend said her cobb salad was good. Guess I was the only unlucky one. I also noticed the bread wasn't very fresh either. Not sure if I would come back to the this location, the other two are much much better.

It's CPK, come on! Mr. Wolfgang has created a brand that is likely his best till this day. This is the local CPK for the Encino area. A little tough to get to in some respects but it's worth the extra few feet of walking time as the service has always been friendly and responsive. As far as food? It's consistently what you would expect from CPK, tasty and fresh.

I have been here 2x on my stay here...  Today  was the absolutely worst I have ever had in ANY of locations.  My first experience with them when I arrived wasn't that great either. I'm very disappointed!!!!
Dog friendly patio.  Water bowls for the puppies  and the food is, well.  It is CPK. You know what you're getting.

I give this place two stars because while the food & busboy were awesome,  the service was deplorable!! My co-worker & I (who both work in a restaurant) had worked up quite the appetite due to shopping for about 5 hours.  We decided to go to CPK because she really likes it & it was close by.  When we arrived the host was friendly enough, and sat us down and told us our server would be with us shortly. Now, as previously stated, I've worked in restaurant in for years & totally understand when it's busy and it may take you awhile to get to the table.  It was actually a pretty mellow night, and we were in a chill mood, so we sat looking over the menu and waiting for someone to take our drink order.  And waited.....and waited....and waited.  I honestly hate giving bad reviews because I can relate to having a bad day or being swamped.  But when you have all that extra help, seems a little odd it would take that long.  Once our food order was in, that came out really fast and was amazing.  Try the roasted peach salad, it is so freaking good!!! I want to make it clear that the server wasn't rude, just  inattentive and not very friendly.  We saw her once the whole time we ate...that's with an appetizer, salad & our entrees that we had to get through.  Didn't drop our food, didn't check to see if we were ok.  She actually walked past us and didn't even give us a second look.  On the other hand, the busser was amazing.  Friendly as could be, helpful and got us refills. &  bread while we waited. Towards the end of our meal, our server came over  to check on us and to box our food up.   Even with not friendly service, I can't help but leave 20% as it's practically ingrained in me to do so.  It was for the busser mainly, but I know he didn't get to keep it :(  Had this place been busier or if they didn't have bussers and food runners to help, then I'd be way more lenient on the service. So, we packed up and then we left, with not a single person said goodby to us...not even our server that we passed on our way out. All in all, great food but lackluster service.
I ordered on eat24 and it took 2 hours!!!!! I will never order Cpk for delivery again. The food got here cold, the pizza was grease and the crust was gross.
Always good food. A place you can take kids. Prices are a bit higher than I'd like for a whole family. But you know what you're getting and it's always good.

Most of their salads are wonderful, as are their pizzas. Since I'm not so much a pizza gal, I gravitate toward the salads. Their cobb salad can't be beat imo.  The greens are chilled just right, applewood smoked bacon, chicken, (with or without) beets, avocado and bleu cheese with just the right amount of sharpness. You can order half portions of the salads.   I can't stress this enough: SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT because they have THEE MOST AMAZING butter cake in the world! They warm it up and put vanilla ice cream on top and you'll think you've died and gone to heaven. It's enough for two but you won't want to share.  James as a server is the best! He is so friendly that you may be tempted to ask him to pull up a chair and join you.  Anyway, good California cuisine, attentive and friendly service and a nice atmosphere at this Encino location.

We eat at CPK pretty regularly back home and popped in for a quick bite while visiting from out of town. Our server, Gabby, made our experience a complete delight! She was so personable and attentive. The food was delicious, as usual, but I only wish she worked at our local restaurant in Florida. Sometimes people make all the difference!

A group of us gals came here and sat outside on the lovely patio. The service was pretty good, although at times we had to flag down our waiter. My friend who is vegetarian ordered the barbecue chicken salad but substituted the chicken for avocado and although it was tasty, the cook failed to remove the chicken so it had to be returned to wait for a new salad.  The Spinach flat bread appetizer wasn't bad but a little expensive for its tiny size @ $7.50.  The arugula salad with asparagus was tasteless and had hardly any asparagus. My friend ordered the cheese macaroni appetizer and much to her disappointment was informed later that they were out of it. How long does it take to make another batch of it? So all in all we weren't doing too well.  But then the excellent manager took over and made good on all their mistakes by giving us a wonderful free dessert which made us all VERY happy in the end.  I highly recommend the Butter cake with ice cream and whipped cream.

Great place to eat with the family, we were there on for dinner this past Saturday and we had a great time as always! It's my second time at this location and just like the other ones (studio city and Tarzana) I can't find anything to complaint about. Our host and waiter were so lovely and happy and he was always on too of everything, patient ( I have a two year old that is very handful) and this young man ( I wish I remember his name) was always there at the right moment :) and cute looking too! Prices are very reasonable and a great menu for kids!  Needless to say we'll keep coming!  Keep up the good job CPK!

I was on my lunch hour and happened to be in Encino for work last Thursday the 6th.  I walked in and ordered the Gluten Free BBQ Chicken Pizza.  I appreciate that they ask if it's an actually allergy or just a preference.  I have a true allergy, so they go through a more extensive process to ensure there is no cross contamination.  I was told the wait would be 15min.  30 minutes later I see a guy pull out an extremely burnt pizza, and was picking the char off of it.  Then he was squirting bbq sauce all over it to cover up how burnt it was.  That charred excuse for pizza happened to be mine.  I was so hungry that I didn't even say anything.  I was severely disappointed that I spent $16 on BBQed charcoal.  I will not be returning to this specific CPK, and have serious reservations about patronizing any of their locations.

I've eaten here and other CPK numerous times. I like this location the most though. Service here is great and servers are very attentive especially during the lunch hours. They have everything from soups, pizzas, sandwiches, to pastas. I personally like the bbq chop salad or the chicken pesto flatbread.  On hot summer days I like to sit outside under the umbrellas, enjoy my lunch and watch the busy street of Ventura.  This CPK is located on the 2nd floor in the Encino place. Make sure to park on Woodley and bring your tix to get validation.

Its been a while since we've gone to CPK.  The menu has changed bit, and no longer had my Shrimp Parmesan or Shrimp Diavolo.   I ordered the SHRIMP SCAMPI ZUCCHINI FETTUCCINE, my wife ordered GARLIC CREAM FETTUCCINE with chicken. My daughter order the HABANERO CARNITAS pizza and my son had mac n cheese.  Since we signed up for their Pizza Dough rewards, we received a small plate selection for free.  We chose the CRISPY MAC 'N' CHEESE.  It was really good. When they brought our meal they brought a CARNITAS TACOS plate instead of the Habanero Carnitas pizza. We told them it should be the pizza, and they took it back. Brandon our server came over and apologized for the error.  I told him, its OK.  But you can bring back the tacos if you're just going to throw them away.  We laughed as he brought them back. The tacos looked good and so did the salsa.  WTH? Who would think that carnitas tacos at CPK would really be good.  I will be the first to say, they were awesome! The carnitas, the avocado salsa and the red salsa were incredible.  Wendy (the manager) came over and apologized and ask how we liked the tacos. I told basically what I said before.  I really didn't think they were going to be that good, but they were amazing. Tina had intended to only eat half of her Fettuccine, but finished it off.  I of course not only devoured one of the carnitas tacos, but finished my Shrimp Scampi. The staff were very friendly, attentive and personable.  We didn't have dessert, but had mentioned the Butter Cake we would have to try on our next visit. The manager walked over and was disappointed we were about to leave.  She said she was going to bring us a Butter Cake on the house.  We thanked her, but told her how full we were. So she offered to send it home with us!  You know, it really was "As good as it gets!" The service, the food, the customer service, and the window seat above Ventura Blvd. It was a great experience. Thanks Brandon, Wendy and the rest of the CPK Encino Staff.

I've been to many CPK locations and they all have been great.. What separates this location is the outstanding service displayed by management and waiters. Starting from the introductions.. then to the meals... then dessert, it was awesome. The spinach artichoke dip and BBQ Chicken Pizza are a MUST!!!
Love coming here. Except when one specific manager is there. She's a vibe killer and all the servers seem stressed when's she around. Makes it a bit unpleasant.

Just had lunch there with 16 co workers.  James is an excellent waiter, who was completely professional and nice!    The food is delicious and the customer service is better than any other restaurant in Encino.

To start off my review, I will not be coming back to this location ever again. This place has so much potential but such a waste. I came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch and there were a ton of people. Nearly the entire inside seating area was full. The reason my experience was so unpleasant was because there were fruit flies all over, the utensils and glasses were dirty (not just water stains) and the food wasn't very tasty. I had order a Pizza, can't really remember which one, and the crust was undercooked and the toppings were all falling off. The service was okay I guess but I was really expecting a lot more from this location. Maybe after reading this review some things might change. :(

Very good pizza and wine selection. They've been improving there wine and beer selection over the last year. If you go here often I recommend you look for gift card deals at Costco. You can typically save 10-20% this way

Came here on a Saturday evening and Chad (our server) was very nice & helpful. Not only did he provide us excellent service but our food was served very quickly.  This is one of the few locations that still have the Four Cheese Ravioli on their menu. Chad did inform us that they will be getting the new menus in about 2 weeks so that means I'll have to come by again before the four cheese ravioli is gone forever :( overall great experience here :)

First off I'd like to thank everyone for the hard work you guys do cuz I've seen the way your "costumers" treat you. It's shameful that people like that even exist! I came in for a late lunch around 3/4 pm and it's wasn't busy at all which was nice. I noticed that a lot of servers sitting down eating, talking not a big deal it didn't affect my service or experience of the place. But I was curious as to why they were sitting down so I asked. They do not have a brake room or an area for servers to sit when they on brake or not even on yet!!!! Crazy right!!?? So they weren't even working!!! Do you guys do you don't  worry about the stuck up people who think their untitled or that their word is law. I had a great lunch and would gladly come back anytime. Thanks CPK

Went here for desert with a group. Had several of them best of all was the desert butter cake. It was pretty good and warm and did I say pretty good? Other deserts; apple and chocolate type...naah, skip them. Service was pretty decent even late as we were there, waitress was on the ball. The only reason for 3 stars was the semi flavorless peach tea I had. Bathrooms were clean.

First, I must brag about our server Jake! He was above and beyond an incredible server.  Thanks Jake! Second, we had the California Club Pizza. It was very tasteful. Don't be afraid of this order as it's covered in a seasoned lettuce topping. It was very good, with Applewood smoked bacon, tomato, lettuce, and if I'm not mistaken argula cheese.  I could be wrong. Besides, the fact it was a very good pizza glad I tried it.  Don't forget to try their flavored iced teas. I had a strawberry Iced Tea it was really good.  See you soon, CPK!

The pizza I ordered was not a thin crust but what I received was a burned pseudo crust.  My friend ordered a chicken dish where the chicken was uncooked and inedible.  Even empty the service was lacking at best.   Sad what happened to this once wonderful restaurant.

Horrible customer service!!!!!! Went there to have dinner and had an hour before it was suppose to close and was turned away because they wanted to close early and go home. So they refused to seat us. Total waste of time driving over. Never coming back again.

The tequila chicken fettuccine: pasta was served almost warm, there was little onion, even less chicken, huge plate, small portion (compared to overflowing plates around). Service: nice and friendly, deserved 4 stars

DO NOT EVER EAT AT THIS CPK. THE MANAGER, MANNI IS THE RUDEST AND MOST UNPROFESSIONAL MANAGER of any restaurant we have ever been to!!!  After waiting for over an hour for three salads and three Mac and cheese for the kids, I decided to let the manager know. Once I asked for the manager, some guy in the kitchen turns to me (from the Kitchen and we were in the dining area) and says yah.  Not a hello, not a can I help you, not even a, you need something? All I got was yah. Once he finally came to our table, I asked him, is this how he was trained by CPK, to just say Yah from the kitchen? He then said what is the problem. I explained to him that we have been waiting for over an hour for our food and that all we had were 3 salads and 3 Mac and cheese. His reply........you haven't been here an hour. It's been 50 min.  Instead trying to fix the problem he made it a bigger problem. Given that CPK has multiple locations and owners, I would suggest to the district manager that you need to retrain your GMs as they are clueless and rude when it comes to handling customer complaints.  Had Manni handled it like any other manager and simply said, I'm sorry, let me fix the problem, I would never have written this review and there wouldn't be hundreds of other potential customers reading this 1 star review either.  I guess CPK and all the officers don't give a crap about service. Maybe this is why they have NO LOCATIONS with any higher than a 3 star Yelp rating. Good luck surviving as a business cause I for one and all my friends and family  would never go back to this CPK.

5 Stars!! This place is one of my favorites!! The place is nice with lots of space, and a nice dining terrace with a great view, and the food is amazing! I usually get either the bbq chicken pizza or the tequila chicken pasta! They are both so addicting! And the desserts are also very good, I like their chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream, so addicting!

Just walked out of there with my wife with empty stomachs. This is the first time we went to this location, oh boy was it a mistake.  First of all we love CPK, we eat at CPK all the time, food always good and service is good too, but tonight at this location is bad. We sat down for 5 minute and nobody even looked at us, all we see was all these employees  talking to each other, i understand if it was a busy night, but it wasnt ans there were only 4 parties in the whole restaurant and 3 of them was already about to leave. All the emloyees were talking and laughing and having a fun time while we sat there waiting if anyone of them would even look our way. Very disappointing-

We went to CPK in Encino & the manager (Erika) was so wonderful.  I did not like my salmon & she took care of me.. Excellent customer service!! Thank you so much! The place is clean & the staff are great. They validate parking. The manager really aims to please & I saw that Erika walked around to other tables to see how they were doing.   Excellent service!

Service (1 star): Really disappointing experience on a Saturday afternoon. It took a couple of minutes for us to be greeted and seated. Our seats had food on them and the glass windows in our view were very dirty with finger prints. The restaurant was not very busy as it was mid-afternoon, but we waited at least 10 minutes for someone to come over to take our drink orders, and it was unclear who our server was. We ordered an appetizer and pizzas, and a couple of other tables who were seated after us got their food before we did. The two people who were helping us were nice, but the service was very slow, and there were several servers (and cooks) standing around talking to each other. I noticed other tables looking up for their servers during this time, as well. Food (3 stars): The tortilla spring rolls were okay (do NOT recommend the Thai ones) and our pizzas were good. I like that they are now serving French bread with olive oil instead of slices of dry white bread. I think CPK has gone downhill in the last few years, and for the price, not worth it.

Unfortunately many people use Yelp as some kind of forum to give their opinions on things that they have no clue about. The food was great-it's a standard with CPK. The chicken piccata, Kung Pao Spaghetti and Habanero carnitas pizza are definite favorites and a must try.  Servers, thank you for all your hard work. It's a thankless job, and sadly, not enough customers are appreciative and act as if you are sub-human, so let me say-I appreciate you. I've seen the way customers treat servers at this specific location and it's just gross. Thanks for the great work and yummy food to all the staff. You matter!

The 5-stars goes directly to our waiter Andrew. According to Murphy's law, whatever can go wrong will go wrong... That pretty much sums up our night tonight at CPK. But Andrew was so helpful and accommodating when dealing with each mishap. Thank you for making our experience so pleasant... CPK Encino is lucky to have you! :)

Was going to come here but there was no nearby parking and the parking structure now is "valet only" what a joke. The signs all say self parking yet when you pull up for a ticket it's valet only. You used to be able just to park, never coming back here.
Their Waldorf and quinoa salads, for dinner, eat in or take home, you'll be VERY HAPPY !  Same for the flatbreads! WOW!

We've eaten at this CPK several times now and every time they manage to find a way to screw something up!!!  The restaurant is ALWAYS dirty with un-cleared, unclean tables and garbage all over the floors!!!  The last time we were at the Encino location our food came out on plates that were so filthy and gross that I had to get a manager and show her what had been served to us. To her credit she was very apologetic and gracious in the way she handled and address the situation, but as I result of how sick to my stomach I get when I think of how nasty dirty the plates were that they expected me to eat off of, I will NEVER go back to this location again. The manager further went on to tell us that when she took over the Encino location that it was the worst restaurant in the chain at the time. From what we have personally experienced, it still is!!! In addition, the previous 2 times we were there we didn't get our earned pizza dough points that we were entitled to.
Consistently good food at ok prices. It's also located in a shopping center with a plaza kids can play in....

I love CPK and everything is so good there! I never really had a problem with the CPKs I usually go too but this one was just not as great as the other ones. I had lunch with my friend because she had gift cards here that CPK corporate have her from a past bad visit. When we got to this location it was not full at all because we were having a late lunch. First order drinks and our waiter was nice! I order a coke but then change my mind and wanted the leamonade instead and he was very nice about that. Then I said a comment to my friend "why didn't he take our menus?" Because I thought we order for some reason and then I realized "oh he hasn't even taken out order!" And we laughed because I can be an air head sometimes! Haha the waiter comes out of no where and was all like " I heard you said that I didn't take your order yet!" I explained to him what happen and he didn't seem amused. So we get our food, the ravioli was so good and then the white pizza not so good! We changed that for the Sicilian pizza which was better. When we wanted to change the pizza we had to talk to the manager first. He was nice and friendly but I can tell he seemed annoyed that we wanted to change the order. When we asked our waiter for his opinion he had an attitude about it saying "well my most favorite was crossed out" just a weird thing to say. So then we get the check and he forgot to take off the coke I had order and when we try to track him down as he was talking to an other waiter but kept looking at us he finally came over and I told him he left the coke oh their still and he respond "ohhhhhh I diddddd?!" I don't know how to take that so he took the check and never apologized when he was giving us back out check!  Now don't get me started on the costumer service! When we were sat down everyone who freaking worked there seemed to be on a break and were all sitting/standing by there larger table in the restaurant all on their phones and just talking so loudly I could not enjoy my meal. Just talking about gossip and boyfriend issues and things that they should not talk about. It's just weird because they weren't in their break room. And the managers joined them too. It was just weird I love CPK too so it kinda put me down.

Today is veterans day, so I got a free plate of pasta. It wasn't as good as the wording on the menu portrays it. Don't let the delicious words fool your taste buds! Speaking collectively for all of us vets; one does not simply give a vet who has served this country and has given a lot: lukewarm food, and two black hairs on the plate. I did not feel like complaining and making a bigger deal than what it was, but I am dissapointed with the quality of food, and customer service that was given to me.The sauce was tasteless as was the chicken. It's pathetic how Veterans' get better quality food from a hungry man dinner than a popular resturant. I'll put it this way, my wife paid for her food and she got way better quality food. I'll end there.
Friendly staff and good food. Not a huge fan of fancy pan pizza and definitely not a fan of paying $15+ for a small sized one either. It's good but not my favorite
Wow! This was a huge mistake coming back !  The pizza had almost no toppings and no sauce. Just card board!  Never again

Food was good as usual but the reason for my review today is to give Carlos the manager at the Encino location a big thank you.  We had an issue with our phone order today and Carlos stepped In and offered to comp the whole meal which he did.  Thank you kind sir.  It's because of you that we will be coming back.
My waiters are awesome and we sat down as soon as we walk in the door.  And had are drinks seconds later loving the service at this cpk

I really like you BBQ chicken salad. It's really good and I love what you put in it. The Mac in chess is terrible. It's so soggy and tasteless. Might as well go to macaroni grill. The pizza is very mediocre. It's not fresh and homemade. Just by tasting it it tasted like it was from the market. There are way better restaurants around. The Tarzana location is better.      One thing I really enjoyed that really surprised me was the ribeye steak. I was never a fan of your food, but that steak was one of the best steaks I ever tried. I am not exaggerating about that. It tasted like you killed a cow in the kitchen and cooked it on the spot. They really surprised me. That was too good. Do You guys have your own farm? Because the steak tasted like you did. There is no way that was refrigerated. That steak was probably the reason why karma went out of business. That steak would succeed in New York City.
Love their pizza, pepperoni, mushroom and sauce and their citrus adobo margarita is awesome

So Sorry CPK but your food has WAY too many calories in it!! Absolutely unbelievable.  And it is not just the pizzas that are loaded with calories, the salads, appetizers, sandwiches, soups... they are all super high in calories.  Sorry but if I'm going to eat unhealthy I am not wasting it on mediocre commercial food. See you never CPK! BUT to be nice.. Their Pear & Gorgonzola pizza is delicious. Great flavor combination. I have loved CPK for ever! i have been dining at the Encino location for the past 10 years and I do like it. The only issue can be service at times. Last time we went we sat on the patio and waited 20 min to place the drink order (I kid you not) :( after we finally got service things were good and food was consistent as always.  The lady who always seats with the short blonde hair is always nice and chipper. Also Mario is great if you get his humor and are not in a rush.  Love the italian chop, the crispy mac and cheese and tostada pizza yummmmmmy!!!! I would give 5 stars for food and 3 for service :)

It's hard to review a chain restaurant without being biased.  This one is especially challenging since I've always loved CPK. However, yesterday we received "review worthy" service.  Not only was the staff super sweet but, they went the extra mile when preparing my baby's food.  They cut everything up for me into little pieces which saved me a huge headache.  That has never been done for me before in any other restaurant. Usually the kid's meals at most restaurants are super greasy with little nutritional value but, they've added some great stuff. You can now get your little monster grilled chicken pieces with broccoli and if you want you can substitute fruit for the broccoli free of charge.  Awesome! BTW, after your done eating, you can take your little downstairs for a carousel ride for only $1.50. (You buy the ticket at Karen's Toy Store) For the grown ups, here are some of my favorite dishes: Tortilla Spring Rolls: Mediterranean Thai Crunch Salad Kung Pao Spaghetti Spaghetti Bolognese Garlic Chicken Pizza (for some reason Cholula goes really well with this) Hawaiian Pizza

This CPK is like the CPK training facility where nothing happens correctly. The service is incredibly slow and sloppy. Every table seemed to have problems with their order. It's so weird because they've got staff to cover at least 50% more tables but they operate like they can only manage half of that. Pretty disappointed with this location.
Loved it! Great food! Service was perfect. I love the location and it is a pretty big CPK. I am definitely going to come to this cpk more often.

I walked to here from my hair salon down the street. I originally wanted to go to Red's for wine and tapas, but they were closed, so CPK was my next choice. It was OK, early afternoon, not too many people. There were a couple families there, it was really loud for it not being very crowded. The food was just OK, the overall experience was OK.

What a difference a few months make. CPK Encino has really steeped up their hospitality.  Great new management team. Staff is in new uniforms.  Clean inviting and fun vibe in the air. Guess what? Fresh baked bread from the La Brea Bakery. Come check out what Encino has to offer!

I couldn't help but to feel overly disappointed as I walked back to the office from my lunch break.  Today I decided to go to California Pizza Kitchen in hopes of eatting something delicious and filling (but not too filling- nothing like going back to work feeling like it's nappy time).  I was seated by a very nice young man followed by my waitress and was presented with about 4 different menus. One for wine and beer, one with health info, one for there new 'smaller portions and items', and then the actual full menu. Wow- now that's a lot of menus.  After browsing all my options I decided to get something new off there 'smaller portions' menu. So I ordered the White Corn Tamale Ravioli. Sounds good doesn't it?  Unfortunately, it wasn't. All I could taste was salt and corn. Salt and corn. Salt. Salt. Salt. and corn. And - although I knew it was off there 'smaller  portions' menu- it was soooooo small. My plate had 4 bite size ravioli's on it, covered in corn and a white sauce. Yes, 4 bite size pieces. ( I don't even think a 3 yr old would be full from this) And the cost... $6.49. That's a whopping $1.62 a bite! I don't know about you- but if I spend close to $7.00 plus tax and tip for a lunch- I better be leaving there filling full and happy.  Instead, I'm sitting here writing this. Feeling way more hungry than I did before and after a soda, a very small dish of food, tax and tip- my bank account is now $11.00 less.  CPK- sorry, although you have great customer service- it's just not worth it:(
