This place was decent, service a bit slow, food was okay, good looking waitresses but with a bit of an attitude usually. I'll be back at some point but hope to see some improvement.

Love this place. I always go in my military uniform with my co-workers and they treat us like VIP's. The food is amazing, I always get a thin crust pizza with mushrooms, sausage and pepperoni and a side of salsa. Yummy! The salsa BTW is extremely Spicy soooo BEWARE.

My wife and I sat down outside on this beautiful spring evening. It is really nice to be able to eat outdoors. The following little story is a perfect metaphor for what CPK is, a corporate restaurant that is above average. The waiter brought out the bread. Three pieces for my wife and I. I joked to the waiter that we were going to fight over the third piece and why bring three small pieces for two people. The waiter explained to me that it was company policy to bring one more slice of bread than there are people at the table. That explains it. Everything about CPK is corporate policy. And what you have is a highly robotic staff and highly standard corporate food. The good news it that the food is pretty good. I had the Cesar Salad and barley/split pea soup. Both above average. I must admit leaving not totally satisfied and at the same time, I had no complaints. One of the things that I really like is that you can try anything and if you don't like it, they will bring you something else. One time I did ask for a different meal and they happily obliged. So my hat is off to Corporate America and it's child California Pizza Kitchen.
The pizza salad is my favorite. This CPK was a hangout for my mother and I, we always went there after a day of shopping. The garlic chicken pizza with a whole wheat crust is healthy and delicious.

After a long day of work and a few meetings, I was totally craving a Hawaiian BBQ pizza.  It's been forever seen I have eaten here so it was definitely worth to splurge and treat myself to it.  The good part was I stayed within my weightwatcher points for the day too!!  Service was great, parking for 2 hours free with validation at restaurant, not too crowded during the week, plenty of outdoor seating--  by far the best BBQ chicken pizza any restaurant has to offer...hands down!

I was a little unhappy about the not having dogs on their patio but the manager explained that its inclosed and the health dept wont let pets on the patio. Other than that We got there about 15 minutes before they opened and we were not welcomed at all it seemed we were an inconvience. Out of all the places we could have had lunch we chose to eat there and they made me feel very unwelcomed. Are server was not friendly until the end of our meal... You know tip time. I dont think we will go back to this one.

Worst CPK that I have been to. I really should have read the reviews before coming here. The service is awful. The chef doesn't have a clue what he is doing. The pizza was cold, they had to change the salad twice to get it right finally.. They were out of Gorgonzola cheese and the starter breads... We were really hungry when we reached but got our food 45 minutes after ordering on a slow night despite being fully staffed... Pfftt!! I am so miffed that I am writing this review while still in the restaurant.. Will never come back here again!?!?!   X-(

In this area, there are hundreds of other places with food that's better quality and less expensive than CPK.   Went at lunch, 2 people, 2 overly sweet ice teas, one average tasting pizza and one entree of spaghetti and meat sauce that tasted like what I would expect if McDonald's served spaghetti...45 dollars. WTF?  Not worth it.

By far the worst CPK ive ever been too. Food quality is poor, and the hosts have no idea how arrange for seating. My friend and I went for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and were told to wait till there were many empty tables. We were finally seated and then were never given utensils to use. FORGET REFILLS, those don't really exist here. Honestly just eat else ware, this CPK brings down the whole chain.

Everyone in Los Angeles has been to a CPK somewhere... you either love it or you hate it. This particular location is best if you're getting a group of people together for lunch while you're at work. The staff here is usually very nice and on top of their game. If you frequent enough, which people in my office to, they know your names and drink orders. This is usually a nice perk at restaurants because they treat you well consistently.  As most people agree, CPK is pricey, but that's just the way it goes. The food is consistently good and depending on the day relatively quick. Drinks: I love the flavored iced teas, lemonades are usually good, try to peach or mango iced tea. Yum! Some of my meal favorites are: Avocado Club Rolls (SO delish, so fattening though!), Spring Rolls, Lettuce wraps and Senora rolls! All very good to start! Then main course, my all time favorite is the Waldord Salad, it's so unique and yummy! Next, I love the tortilla soup, it's so much better than any other restaurants, it's so thick and creamy! Makes a delicious starter to lunch or dinner, or good on those cold days. Pesto Creme Penne is one of the best pasta dishes I've tried anywhere, but the portion is huge, TRY it if you love shrimp.  The club sandwiches are awesome too, love those... The pizza...the most important thing on the menu...it is the PIZZA kitchen afterall. My favorites are the California Club, Thai Chicken, Chipotle, White and Pesto Pizza... each has their unique perks. Some people like their pizza plain and simple, cheese and sauce but their pizzas have personality! If you're down for something different, give it a try...if not stick with the White,  Tradiitional or Pepperoni...can't go wrong! Just remember it's a totally different experience than regular delivery pizza.

I really like this place, its clean, good atmosphere, food is good, but service???  I am not sure if they know the meaning of service.  It has been terrible for about 6-8 months and why do I keep going???  We sat there for at least 10 min. and no one came to us.  Then, our appetizers came out at the same time as the main course.  We did not see our waitress for quite a while.  We had to ask for bread, cheese, and she kept bringing us the wrong teas.  This is not the first time, we have had an extremely poor experience there.  It recently went through a change of ownership and I think it is worse now!  DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION!!!!  I will try the one in Studio City.

Pro:sicilian pizza good meats and cheese blend, Thai crunch salad combination of the flavors just go so well. Service is very good on time and knowledgable. Con:not all the Cpk's carry the same consistency on the menu you will love this locations against the other ones

great food and service. price is okay. thats all i need to say
